intro: Delissea ligulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf delissea, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Delissea ligulata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and native garden landscapes.
